questions.question_text:
Let H$$_1$$, H$$_2$$, ..., H$$_n$$ be mutually exclusive and exhaustive events with P(H$$_i$$) > 0, i = 1, 2, ..., n. Let E be any other event with 0 Statement 1 : P(H$$_i$$ | E) > P(E | H$$_i$$). P(H$$_i$$) for $$i=1,2,...,n$$.

Statement 2 : $$\sum\limits_{i = 1}^n {P({H_i}) = 1} $$.

option_texts.B: Statement 1 is True, Statement 2 is True, Statement 2 is NOT a CORRECT explanation for Statement 1
option_texts.C: Statement 1 is True, Statement 2 is False
option_texts.D: Statement 1 is False, Statement 2 is True

option_texts.C: Statement 1 is True, Statement 2 is False

questions.question_text:
Consider the following linear equations

$$ax + by + cz = 0$$

$$bx + cy + az = 0$$

$$cx + ay + bz = 0$$

Match the conditions/expressions in Column I with statements in Column II.


.tg  {border-collapse:collapse;border-spacing:0;}
.tg td{border-color:black;border-style:solid;border-width:1px;font-family:Arial, sans-serif;font-size:14px;
  overflow:hidden;padding:10px 5px;word-break:normal;}
.tg th{border-color:black;border-style:solid;border-width:1px;font-family:Arial, sans-serif;font-size:14px;
  font-weight:normal;overflow:hidden;padding:10px 5px;word-break:normal;}
.tg .tg-c3ow{border-color:inherit;text-align:center;vertical-align:top}
.tg .tg-7btt{border-color:inherit;font-weight:bold;text-align:center;vertical-align:top}
.tg .tg-0pky{border-color:inherit;text-align:left;vertical-align:top}









  
    
    Column I
    
    Column II
  


  
    (A)
    $$a + b + c \ne 0$$ and $${a^2} + {b^2} + {c^2} = ab + bc + ca$$
    (P)
    the equations represent planes meeting only at a single point.
  
  
    (B)
    $$a + b + c = 0$$ and $${a^2} + {b^2} + {c^2} \ne ab + bc + ca$$
    (Q)
    the equations represent the line $$x=y=z$$.
  
  
    (C)
    $$a + b + c \ne 0$$ and $${a^2} + {b^2} + {c^2} \ne ab + bc + ca$$
    (R)
    the equations represent identical planes.
  
  
    (D)
    $$a + b + c = 0$$ and $${a^2} + {b^2} + {c^2} = ab + bc + ca$$
    (S)
    the equations represent the whole of the three dimensional space.

    Column I
    
    Column II
  


  
    (A)
    $$x|x|$$
    (P)
    continuous in ($$-1,1$$).
  
  
    (B)
    $$\sqrt{|x|}$$
    (Q)
    differentiable in ($$-1,1$$)
  
  
    (C)
    $$x+[x]$$
    (R)
    strictly increasing in ($$-1,1$$)
  
  
    (D)
    $$|x-1|+|x+1|$$
    (S)
    not differentiable at least at one point in ($$-1,1$$)

.tg  {border-collapse:collapse;border-spacing:0;}

  overflow:hidden;padding:10px 5px;word-break:normal;}
.tg th{border-color:black;border-style:solid;border-width:1px;font-family:Arial, sans-serif;font-size:14px;
  font-weight:normal;overflow:hidden;padding:10px 5px;word-break:normal;}
.tg .tg-c3ow{border-color:inherit;text-align:center;vertical-align:top}
.tg .tg-7btt{border-color:inherit;font-weight:bold;text-align:center;vertical-align:top}
.tg .tg-0pky{border-color:inherit;text-align:left;vertical-align:top}









  
    
    Column I
    
    Column II
  


  
    (A)
    $$\int\limits_{ - 1}^1 {{{dx} \over {1 + {x^2}}}} $$
    (P)
    $${1 \over 2}\log \left( {{2 \over 3}} \right)$$
  
  
    (B)
    $$\int\limits_0^1 {{{dx} \over {\sqrt {1 + {x^2}} }}} $$
    (Q)
    $$2\log \left( {{2 \over 3}} \right)$$
  
  
    (C)
    $$\int\limits_2^3 {{{dx} \over {1 + {x^2}}}} $$
    (R)
    $${\pi  \over 3}$$
  
  
    (D)
    $$\int\limits_1^2 {{{dx} \over {x\sqrt {{x^2} - 1} }}} $$
    (S)
    $${\pi  \over 2}$$

option_texts.A: A - s, B - s, C - r, D - p
option_texts.B: A - s, B - q, C - p, D - r
option_texts.C: A - s, B - s, C - p, D - r
option_texts.D: A - s, B - q, C - s, D - r

questions.question_text:
Statement 1 :

A block of mass m starts moving on a rough horizontal surface with a velocity v. It stops due to friction between the block and the surface after moving through a certain distance. The surface is now tilted to an angle of 30$$^\circ$$ with the horizontal and the same block is made to go up on the surface with the same initial velocity v. The decrease in the mechanical energy in the second situation is smaller than that in the first situation.

Statement 2 :

The coefficient of friction between the block and the surface decreases with the increase in the angle of inclination.

    (A)
    GM$$_e$$M$$_s$$
G - universal gravitational constant,
M$$_e$$ - mass of the earth,
M$$_s$$ - mass of the Sun
    (P)
    (volt)
(coulomb)
(metre)
  
  
    (B)
    $${{3RT} \over M}$$
R - universal gas constant,
T - absolute temperature,
M - molar mass
    (Q)
    (kilogram)
(metre)$$^3$$
(second)$$^{-2}$$
  
  
    (C)
    $${{{F^2}} \over {{q^2}{B^2}}}$$
F - force,
q - charge,
B - magnetic field
    (R)
    (metre)$$^2$$
(second)$$^{-2}$$
  
  
    (D)
    $${{G{M_e}} \over {{R_e}}}$$
G - universal gravitational constant,
M$$_e$$ - mass of the earth
R$$_e$$ - radius of the earth
    (S)
    (farad)
(volt)$$^2$$
(kg)$$^{-1}$$

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text:
Column I gives certain situations in which a straight metallic wire of resistance R is used and Column II gives some resulting effects. Match the statements in Column I with the statements in Column II and indicate your answer by darkening appropriate bubbles in the 4 $$\times$$ 4 matrix given in the ORS.


.tg  {border-collapse:collapse;border-spacing:0;}
.tg td{border-color:black;border-style:solid;border-width:1px;font-family:Arial, sans-serif;font-size:14px;
  overflow:hidden;padding:10px 5px;word-break:normal;}
.tg th{border-color:black;border-style:solid;border-width:1px;font-family:Arial, sans-serif;font-size:14px;
  font-weight:normal;overflow:hidden;padding:10px 5px;word-break:normal;}
.tg .tg-c3ow{border-color:inherit;text-align:center;vertical-align:top}
.tg .tg-7btt{border-color:inherit;font-weight:bold;text-align:center;vertical-align:top}
.tg .tg-0pky{border-color:inherit;text-align:left;vertical-align:top}









  
    
    Column I
    
    Column II
  


  
    (A)
    A charged capacitor is connected to the ends of the wire
    (P)
    A constant current flows through the wire
  
  
    (B)
    The wire is moved perpendicular to its length with a constant velocity in a uniform magnetic field perpendicular to the plane of motion
    (Q)
    Thermal energy is generated in the wire
  
  
    (C)
    The wire is placed in a constant electric field that has a direction along the length of the wire.
    (R)
    A constant potential difference develops between the ends of the wire
  
  
    (D)
    A battery of constant emf is connected to the ends of the wire
    (S)
    Charges of constant magnitude appear at the ends of the wire

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text:
Some laws/processes are given in Column I. Match these with the physical phenomena given in Column II and indicate your answer by darkening appropriate bubbles in the 4 $$\times$$ 4 matrix given in the ORS.


.tg  {border-collapse:collapse;border-spacing:0;}
.tg td{border-color:black;border-style:solid;border-width:1px;font-family:Arial, sans-serif;font-size:14px;
  overflow:hidden;padding:10px 5px;word-break:normal;}
.tg th{border-color:black;border-style:solid;border-width:1px;font-family:Arial, sans-serif;font-size:14px;
  font-weight:normal;overflow:hidden;padding:10px 5px;word-break:normal;}
.tg .tg-c3ow{border-color:inherit;text-align:center;vertical-align:top}
.tg .tg-7btt{border-color:inherit;font-weight:bold;text-align:center;vertical-align:top}
.tg .tg-0pky{border-color:inherit;text-align:left;vertical-align:top}









  
    
    Column I
    
    Column II
  


  
    (A)
    Transition between two atomic energy levels
    (P)
    Characteristic X-rays
  
  
    (B)
    Electron emission from a material
    (Q)
    Photoelectric effect
  
  
    (C)
    Mosley's law
    (R)
    Hydrogen spectrum
  
  
    (D)
    Change of photon energy into kinetic energy of electrons
    (S)
    $$\beta$$-decay

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text:
Statement 1 :

The formula connecting u, v and f for a spherical mirror is valid only for mirrors whose sizes are very small compared to their radii of curvature.

Statement 2 :

Laws of reflection are strictly valid for plane surfaces, but not for large spherical surfaces.

option_texts.A: Statement 1 is True, Statement 2 is True, Statement 2 is a CORRECT explanation for Statement 1
option_texts.B: Statement 1 is True, Statement 2 is True, Statement 2 is NOT a CORRECT explanation for Statement 1
option_texts.C: Statement 1 is True, Statement 2 is False
option_texts.D: Statement 1 is False, Statement 2 is True

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text:
Statement 1 :

If the accelerating potential in an X-ray tube is increased, the wavelengths of the characteristic X-rays do not change.


Statement 2 :

When an electron beam strikes the target in an X-ray tube, part of the kinetic energy is converted into X-ray energy.

option_texts.A: Statement 1 is True, Statement 2 is True, Statement 2 is a CORRECT explanation for Statement 1
option_texts.B: Statement 1 is True, Statement 2 is True, Statement 2 is NOT a CORRECT explanation for Statement 1
option_texts.C: Statement 1 is True, Statement 2 is False
option_texts.D: Statement 1 is False, Statement 2 is True
